title: J&K encounter: Security forces trap terrorists in Kulgam
content: Security forces and terrorists engaged in an encounter in Kulgam's Tangmarg area. This followed a deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam's Baisaran Valley, which killed 28 people, including tourists and an Indian Navy officer. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh assured a strong response. Sketches of three Pakistani suspects, Asif Fauji, Suleman Shah, and Abu Talha, were released.

title: Pahalgam attack: Rajnath Singh vows 'loud & clear' response soon
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has promised a firm response to the Pahalgam terror attack. Twenty-six people, mostly tourists, died in the attack. The government will hunt down the perpetrators and those behind the attack. A high-level meeting was held with top military officials. Additional troops are being deployed for search operations.

title: Pakistan cricketer's two words message on Pahalgam attack
content: Mohammad Hafeez expressed grief over the Pahalgam terrorist attack, which resulted in the deaths of at least 28 civilians and left over 20 injured, marking it as one of the deadliest incidents since the 2019 Pulwama bombing. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah have strongly condemned the attack. Shah, in particular, delivered a powerful statement asserting the nation's unwavering resolve against terrorism.

title: US-based TCS employee Bitan Adhikary shot dead in Pahalgam attack
content: Bitan Adhikary, a TCS engineer from Bengal, tragically died in the Pahalgam terror attack in Kashmir. The 40-year-old was vacationing with his wife and son, who survived. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressed condolences and assured assistance in bringing Adhikary's remains back to Kolkata. Adhikary, a US-based techie with 15 years of experience, was the sole provider for his parents.

title: Amir exposes PCB, reveals why he really quit Pakistan cricket… again
content: Mohammad Amir revealed feeling sidelined by the Pakistan cricket setup after the 2024 T20 World Cup due to a lack of communication regarding future plans, leading to his retirement. He also mentioned turning down a County contract to represent Pakistan and advocated for aggressive mindset in cricket. Amir expressed support for Babar Azam's comeback.

title: 'He fell with blood flowing from his head': Wife of accountant killed in Pahalgam
content: Odisha native Prasant Kumar Satpathy tragically died in a terror attack in Pahalgam, Jammu & Kashmir, while vacationing with his family. The 41-year-old was fatally shot, as confirmed by his wife Priyadarshini, who was also present during the attack. Another Odisha resident, Shashi Kumari, sustained injuries and is receiving treatment.

title: Pahalgam attack: Air India, IndiGo, EaseMyTrip offer free changes, refunds
content: Following the tragic Pahalgam terror attack, airlines like Air India and IndiGo are offering complimentary rescheduling and full refunds for affected travelers. Special flights from Srinagar to Delhi and Mumbai have been added, with cancellation and rescheduling fees waived. EaseMyTrip has also extended waivers, coordinating with airlines and local authorities to provide updates amidst increased demand.

title: Watch: Wife of slain Navy officer clings to coffin in tearful farewell
content: The nation mourns the loss of 28 lives in a terror attack in Pahalgam, including navy lieutenant Vinay Narwal, whose recent marriage adds to the tragedy. Emotional farewells were held at Delhi's IGI Airport, with his wife inconsolably grieving. Navy chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi and Delhi CM Rekha Gupta paid respects, while Narwal's remains were taken to his family in Karnal, Haryana.

title: Former Pakistan coach's pay dispute heats up; PCB issues strong statement
content: Pakistan Cricket Board clarifies that Jason Gillespie has received all payments. This follows media reports of alleged unpaid dues. Gillespie reportedly claimed the PCB owes him bonuses. The PCB source states Gillespie did not give the required notice period. Aaqib Javed is now the interim head coach for both formats after Gillespie's and Kirsten's resignations.

title: Vadra links Pahalgam attack to govt's Hindutva push; BJP hits back
content: Robert Vadra sparked controversy by linking the Pahalgam terror attack to the BJP's Hindutva policies, alleging it fueled a divide between Hindus and Muslims, weakening minorities. The BJP swiftly condemned Vadra, accusing him of shielding terrorists and blaming India for the atrocities committed by Pakistani terrorists.

title: Kunal Bahl on Pahalgam attack: Have always told people to visit Kashmir to…
content: Following the tragic Pahalgam terror attack that killed 28, entrepreneur Kunal Bahl, former Snapdeal CEO, expressed his sorrow and announced he would no longer encourage tourism to Kashmir due to safety concerns. Bahl, who previously lauded Kashmir's beauty, cited the recent attack in Baisaran Valley, where gunmen targeted tourists, as the reason for his changed stance.

title: 'Condemning ghastly, cowardly act in Pahalgam': BCCI Secretary
content: The BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia condemned the Pahalgam terror attack, which resulted in the tragic loss of 26 lives and left many injured. Expressing deep shock and anguish, the BCCI extended heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families and offered prayers for the departed souls. The board stands in solidarity with the victims, sharing their pain during this difficult time.

title: Inside Pahalgam plot: Terrorists used code names Moosa, Yunus and Asif
content: Security agencies have identified the three terrorists behind the deadly Pahalgam attack as Asif Fauji, Suleman Shah, and Abu Talha, believed to be TRF operatives using code names Moosa, Yunus, and Asif. Sketches of the suspects, based on survivor accounts, have been released as a search operation intensifies. According to officials, the trio was previously active in Poonch and had a history of orchestrating terror strikes in the region.

title: World Bank cuts India’s FY26 growth forecast to 6.3% citing global headwinds
content: The World Bank has lowered India's GDP growth forecast for FY 2025-26 to 6.3%, citing global economic headwinds and domestic policy uncertainties. The IMF also revised its projection downward to 6.2%. Across South Asia, growth projections have been broadly reduced, with the region expected to grow at 5.8% in 2025.

title: Andhra Pradesh Governor Abdul Nazeer condemns terrorist attack in Jammu & Kashmir
content: Expressing his profound grief over the loss of innocent lives, he says such senseless acts of violence have no place in society

title: Parvatipuram to be developed as a model municipality: MLA
content: MLA Bonela Vijaya Chandra plans civic upgrades for Parvatipuram, said will urge CM Naidu for additional funds to transform the district HQ town

title: Actor Jethwani’s ‘illegal arrest’: 14-day judicial remand for former Intelligence Director-General Sitarama Anjaneyulu
content: The suspended IPS officer is accused of being the key conspirator in foisting a false case against the actor, and arresting her and her family members

title: Madras High Court to take up suo motu writ against T.N. Minister Ponmudy’s derogatory speech
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh directs the Registry to place the matter before Chief Justice K.R. Shriram for appropriate orders

title: Supreme Court tells Senthilbalaji to choose between ministership and his freedom
content: The judge pointed out that Senthilbalaji had not been a Minister at the time of the granting of bail; he had been given bail not on the merits of the case but because of the fundamental right to personal liberty under Article 21 of the Constitution

title: Collector highlights potential of oil palm cultivation in Chittoor district
content: Apart from sugarcane cultivation, which is the predominant crop in the region, oil palm farming can also prove to be a profitable alternative for the farmers due to its lower input costs and minimal crop loss, says Sumit Kumar

title: Faces of terror: Probing agencies release photo of four Pahalgam terrorists
content: Security agencies have released photographs of suspected terrorists involved in the deadly Pahalgam attack in Jammu and Kashmir, which resulted in 28 fatalities. The identified terrorists, using code names, are Asif Fauji, Suleman Shah, and Abu Talha. Simultaneously, security forces foiled an infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in Baramulla, engaging infiltrators in a firefight.

title: Good news! This state slashes EV road tax to just 1% till March ‘26: Details
content: Gujarat is incentivizing electric vehicle adoption with a 5% tax exemption, effectively reducing the tax to 1% until March 2026. Announced by Minister Harsh Sanghavi, this initiative aims to promote eco-friendly mobility and ease the financial burden on EV buyers. Citizens can avail the benefit through the Vahan 4.0 portal.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Pakistan condoles death of tourists
content: Following the deadly terror attack near Pahalgam that killed 28 tourists, Pakistan extended condolences while simultaneously denying any involvement. Pakistan's foreign office expressed concern and offered sympathies, while its defense minister dismissed any link to Islamabad, attributing the violence to internal discontent within India. The attack, which occurred in the Baisaran meadow near Pahalgam, is the deadliest in the Valley since the Pulwama bombing of 2019.

title: Families of victims of terror attack break down, plead in front of Amit Shah - Video
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed at least 28, Union Home Minister Amit Shah met with victims' families in Srinagar, assuring them justice. Security forces will leave no stone unturned to find the perpetrators. Prime Minister Modi, cutting short his Saudi Arabia visit, convened an urgent briefing.

title: ‘India a hot market but...’: Tesla says 100% car tariffs make customers anxious
content: Elon Musk-led Tesla views India as a promising market but is concerned about the 100% tariffs on imported automobiles, which create customer anxiety. Despite securing showroom locations and advertising job positions, the company is carefully evaluating the timing of its entry.

title: Gold at record high! Sovereign gold bond investors eye 221% returns
content: With gold prices soaring to a record ₹1 lakh per 10 grams, Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB) investors are contemplating selling. Those who invested in 2017 are seeing returns of 221%. Financial experts advise maintaining 10-15% of portfolios in gold for stability.

title: Bitcoin beats Amazon in market value; becomes world’s 6th most valuable asset
content: Bitcoin's market capitalisation has surged past Amazon, reaching $1.857 trillion and becoming the sixth-largest asset globally. This rally, fueled by increased institutional investment and spot ETF inflows, has propelled Bitcoin to $93,546.

title: Tariffs 'hurt multilateral trade and world economic order,' says China
content: President Xi Jinping has criticized tariffs. He said that tariffs undermine the global economic order. This statement comes amid tensions between China and the United States. Earlier, Donald Trump imposed tariffs on Chinese imports. China retaliated with duties on American goods. China opposes deals at its expense. Foreign Minister Wang Yi urged the UK and EU to defend multilateral trade.

title: Mohammed Siraj wants terrorists to be punished without mercy
content: Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj has condemned the recent terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, which resulted in the tragic loss of at least 28 lives. In an emotional message on Instagram, Siraj expressed his outrage at the senseless violence against innocent civilians, emphasizing that no ideology can justify such brutality.

title: Nation mourns as J&K victims' stories emerge from different parts - Full List
content: In a devastating terror attack in Jammu & Kashmir, 28 tourists were killed and dozens injured in Pahalgam. The Resistance Front, a Pakistan-backed LeT proxy, claimed responsibility. Gunmen, disguised as Indian Army soldiers, selectively targeted victims, coinciding with high-profile diplomatic visits and escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. The victims included an Indian Navy officer, an IB officer, and tourists from various states.

title: How a warming Himalaya could affect billions of people
content: The Himalayas, Asia's crucial water source, face a severe crisis as snowfall hits a 23-year low, impacting nearly two billion people. Declining snow persistence threatens agriculture, water supplies, and hydroelectric power across major Asian river systems. Urgent action is needed, including regional cooperation, improved water management, and reduced emissions, to mitigate the far-reaching consequences of this climate emergency.

title: 'Trust Thala': CSK CEO's reassuring message to anxious supporters
content: Chennai Super Kings, a five-time IPL champion, is currently struggling in IPL 2025, sitting at the bottom of the table with only two wins. Following a defeat by Mumbai Indians, CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan acknowledged the team's poor performance but expressed hope for a turnaround.

title: Former India cricketer asks Rishabh Pant to stop making excuses
content: Delhi Capitals defeated Lucknow Super Giants by eight wickets, leading to visible frustration for LSG captain Rishabh Pant, who was seen in intense discussions with mentor Zaheer Khan after a duck. Ambati Rayudu suggested Pant needs to take more ownership and bat higher in the order. Pant acknowledged LSG's struggle to find their best combination after the loss.

title: India’s composite PMI hits 8-month high in April
content: India's private sector experienced robust expansion in April, reaching an eight-month high driven by strong demand and a surge in foreign orders, particularly for manufactured goods. The Composite PMI climbed to 60.0, signaling the strongest growth since August, with manufacturing hitting a one-year high. New export orders soared, boosting output and employment across both manufacturing and service sectors.

title: Pahalgam attack: What we know about TRF & plotter Saifullah Khalid
content: The Resistance Front (TRF), a Pakistan-backed terror group, claimed responsibility for a deadly attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, killing 28. This incident, occurring before the Amarnath Yatra, highlights TRF's opposition to Kashmir's integration with India and its threats against non-local settlers. The outfit, a proxy of Lashkar-e-Taiba, aims to disrupt regional stability through violence and recruitment.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Who are the victims? Full list
content: The Pahalgam victims included two foreigners - one from the UAE and the other from Nepal - and two locals. All 26 victims were men.

title: Gold halts record rally, drops ₹2,400 to ₹99,200/10 g amid easing U.S.-China tensions
content: Gold of 99.5% fall sharply by ₹3,400 to ₹98,700 per 10 grams on April 23, a day after jumping ₹2,800 to an all-time high of ₹1,02,100 per 10 grams in the local markets

title: Bhu Bharati portal to be made operational in 28 more mandals in May first week: Telangana Revenue Minister
content: The government does not have plans to extend the last date for payments of fees for LRS beyond April 30, said the Minister

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Pony ride operator sacrificed life to save tourists; CM Omar Abdullah attends his funeral
content: Syed Adil Hussain Shah was the sole breadwinner of his family; his tragic death has left his family in mourning, struggling to cope with the loss, and asking for justice for the loss of the innocent man

title: Mumbai terror attacks: NIA opposes Tahawwur Rana plea to talk to kin, says may share crucial info
content: The judge reserved the order for April 24; Rana had moved an application through his lawyer, claiming that it was his fundamental right to talk to his family

title: Belagavi village erupts in joy as youth from shepherding community clears UPSC
content: Beerappa is a B.Tech graduate who wanted to join the Indian army, like his elder brother, but could not attempt the officers’ recruitment examinations due to various reasons

title: India, U.S. trade talks from April 23 in Washington; to give impetus to BTA negotiations
content: The U.S. has on multiple occasions flagged concerns on widening trade deficit with India, which is $45.7 billion in 2024

title: CLAT UG-2025: Delhi High Court asks National Law Universities consortium to revise marksheets, republish result
content: The judgement came on a batch of petitions pointing out certain errors in the common law admission test (CLAT) UG-2025 questionnaire.

title: T.N. universities’ V-Cs in a dilemma over Governor’s invitation to higher education conference
content: The recent Supreme Court ruling has empowered the State government to appoint V-Cs but does not prevent the Governor from acting as the Chancellor, an expert points out

title: Thiruvananthapuram to host Koottam 2025, the two-day volunteering carnival
content: The festival, organised by Volunteer For India collaborating with the Thiruvananthapuram Municipal Corporation, will take place at Tagore Theatre

title: Landslide hit Jammu-Srinagar National Highway opened for one-way traffic; special train arranged
content: Following the terrorist attack in Pahalgam, authorities in Jammu and Kashmir are making efforts to help tourists return to their home States

title: Supreme Court refuses to stay upcoming BPSC mains exam on April 25
content: A bench comprising Justices Dipankar Datta and Manmohan dismissed a batch of petitions seeking the cancellation of the 70th BPSC Combined Competitive Preliminary Exams, citing a lack of conclusive evidence to justify a re-test for all candidates.

title: Supreme Court condemns Pahalgam attack on tourists as a ‘cowardly act of terrorism’
content: A two-minute silence was observed by judges, lawyers, members of the staff in the court complex to express solidarity with the victims as well as their bereaved families.

title: Mangaluru: With non-functional fountain aerators, Gujjarakere stinks again while fishes die
content: Mangaluru Smart City Ltd., had installed the aerators in July 2022 to oxygenate the water body and remove dissolved organic compounds

title: Ex-cricketer says India should never play cricket with Pakistan
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed at least 26 people, former Bengal cricketer expressed strong sentiments against playing cricket with Pakistan. He emphasized that murdering innocent Indians seemed to be their national sport and urged a response beyond sports.

title: Aryaman Varma: 18-year-old England prodigy's dream wicket is Virat Kohli
content: Aryaman Varma, an 18-year-old leg-spinner, has been awarded the prestigious Wisden Schools Cricketer of the Year award. The Eton College captain's outstanding performance in the 2024 season, where he took a record-breaking 51 wickets, earned him the title. Varma, who was nominated for the award last year as well, expressed his delight at joining the ranks of cricketing legends like Jos Butler and Jonny Bairstow, who are also past winners.

title: J&K attack: Visa issue in planned Euro trip led navy officer to Pahalgam
content: Lieutenant Vinay Narwal, a 26-year-old newlywed from Haryana, was tragically killed in a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, while on his honeymoon. He had married Himanshi Narwal just eight days prior, and they had rerouted their honeymoon to J&K after visa issues prevented a trip to Europe.

title: 2 terrorists killed, infiltration bid foiled in J&K's Baramulla
content: The Indian Army successfully thwarted an infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in Baramulla district, eliminating two terrorists amidst an ongoing operation near Uri. This incident occurred a day after a deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam, which resulted in the deaths of 28 tourists. Security forces recovered a large cache of weapons and ammunition during the operation.

title: Terrorist who shot Karnataka man told his wife: 'Won't kill you, go tell Modi'
content: In a shocking incident, 28 tourists were killed in a terrorist attack near Pahalgam, J&K, marking the deadliest such event since 2019. The Resistance Front, linked to LeT, claimed responsibility. The attack, coinciding with significant international visits and heightened tensions with Pakistan, evoked memories of past massacres.

title: 'Might lose job but ...': Biker releases video after clash with IAF officer in B'luru
content: In Bengaluru, a road rage incident has intensified as BPO employee Vikas Kumar, previously arrested, accuses IAF Wing Commander Shiladitya Bose of assault and false accusations. Vikas claims Bose initiated the altercation after a minor vehicle incident, leading to physical violence and fabricated charges. The situation has escalated with a counter-FIR, protests, and government intervention, highlighting linguistic tensions and demands for justice.

title: Sensex surges over 500 points, crosses 80,000 level; Nifty50 above 24,300
content: Stock market today: Stock markets continued their positive streak for the seventh consecutive day on Wednesday, with the BSE Sensex gaining 520 points to surpass the 80,000 mark for the first time since December 18.

title: Watch: Ubaid Shah’s wild wicket celebration turns into an accident in PSL
content: During a thrilling PSL 2025 match between Multan Sultans and Lahore Qalandars, Multan pacer Ubaid Shah's exuberant celebration after taking a wicket turned comical. He accidentally smacked his teammate, wicketkeeper Usman Khan, on the head. The incident, caught on camera, quickly went viral, turning Shah into the PSL's latest meme sensation.

title: T.N. Assembly pays homage to Pahalgam terror attack victims
content: Speaking in the Assembly, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin strongly condemned the attack that targeted innocent tourists, and extended heartfelt condolences to the families of the deceased

title: T.N. government will take steps to expedite drinking water project work in Palani: Minister
content: Minister K.N. Nehru was responding to a calling attention motion moved by MLAs who sought his intervention to expedite the ongoing drinking water supply project in Palani, one of the six abodes of Lord Murugan

title: FTII Pune, Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute granted university status, says Education Ministry
content: The new status will empower them to award degrees rather than just diplomas and also offer doctoral programmes.

title: T.N. government will prioritise widening Jayankondam-Kumbakonam highway, says Minister
content: Minister E.V. Velu was responding to a question by Jayankondam MLA Ka.So.Ka. Kannan in the Assembly, who sought to widen the existing two-way lane into a four-way lane between Jayankondam to Kumbakonam

title: T.N. government approves Chennai Metro Rail’s Airport-Kilambakkam project, forwards proposal to Centre
content: The project would significantly improve the commute for those residing in the city’s southern areas, such as Chromepet, Pallavaram, Tambaram, and Perungalathur

title: U.S. Vice President JD Vance reaches Agra, CM Yogi extends warm welcome
content: In Agra roads were lined with the national flags of India and the United States, along with colorful rangolis, intricate sand art, and eye-catching decorations.

title: Court dismisses claim on Hyderabad’s Bathukamma Kunta, rules in favour of HYDRAA certifying it as lake
content: A civil suit filed by one Yedla Sudhakar Reddy claiming that the land was his, and not a lake has been dismissed by the court, a press release from HYDRAA said

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Two Kashmiri men who went to Pakistan in 2018 suspected to be among the terrorists who killed tourists
content: Based on eyewitness accounts, the Jammu and Kashmir Police released the sketches of three Pakistanis who carried out the attack.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Two from Andhra Pradesh shot dead by militants
content: Retired SBI employee Chandramouli and senior architect Somisetti Madhusudhan Rao are among the 26 civilians shot dead by militants in J&K’s Pahalgam

title: Madras High Court reverses discharge of T.N. Minister Duraimurugan from 2002 disproportionate assets case
content: Justice P. Velmurugan allows a criminal revision filed by DVAC in 2013 against the 2007 discharge order passed by a special court in Vellore

title: Deputy explosive commissioner’s office in Kendriya Bhavan in Kerala’s Kakkanad receives email bomb threat
content: The mail warned of placing explosive devices in the Petroleum and Explosives Safety Organisation (PESO) in Ernakulam

title: T.N. Raj Bhavan slams media reports portraying V-C conclave as power struggle with government
content: It is unfortunate that some ill-informed media reports have given this well-intentioned academic exercise a political twist, wrongly linking it with the recent Supreme Court judgment, the Raj Bhavan said in a statement

title: Protesting Bengal teachers allow gheraoed SSC chairman to leave office after 40 hours
content: One of the protesters belonging to the Deserving Teachers Forum said SSC chairman was allowed to leave both because he had to be physically present at the court and also to give him some reprieve from confinement on health grounds.

title: The Resistance Front: The banned organisation behind Pahalgam terror attack
content: The Resistance Front or TRF was founded in October 2019, months after Centre bifurcated Jammu and Kashmir, and abrogated Article 370

title: Withdraw G.O. to recruit Group D staff on contract basis: Anbumani Ramadoss
content: In a statement, he said this should not have been done when there is a growing demand to convert contract jobs into permanent ones

title: Terrorist attack on tourists in Pahalgam is cowardly act, says A.P. Congress chief Y. S. Sharmila
content: APCC President Y.S. Sharmila condemns terrorist attack in Pahalgam, calls for unity against terrorism and support for victims’ families

title: Pahalgam terrorist attack: Jana Sena to mourn for three days
content: K. Pawan Kalyan stated in a press release that the attack was heinous, and expressed condolences to the families of the deceased

title: Shutdown against terror attack in Kashmir valley, first time in 35 years
content: Most of the shops, fuel stations and other business establishments were shut in Srinagar, the officials said; only shops dealing in essential commodities were open across the city; Kashmir University has postponed all examinations scheduled on April 23.

title: Pahalgam terror strike | Telangana govt sets up helpline to assist and address concerns
content: Senior officials at Telangana Bhavan are coordinating with Jammu & Kashmir State administration as well as central authorities and are monitoring the situation closely.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: No fireworks, cheerleaders in MI vs SRH IPL match
content: The players of Sunrisers Hyderabad and Mumbai Indians will wear black armbands to mourn the victims of the terrorist attack in Pahalgam during their IPL match today, April 23

title: Zoho Schools of Learning expands to two new locations in Tamil Nadu
content: The Tharuvai campus will host the technology and business schools and the Kumbakonam campus will start with a school of technology

title: Body of Keralite killed in Pahalgam terrorist attack likely to be flown into Kochi tonight
content: Air India flight AI 1828/AI 503 likely to transport deceased’s body from Srinagar to Delhi, then to Kochi; Last rites on April 24, 2025

title: Pahalgam attack: J-K government announces ₹10L ex-gratia for each deceased's family; ₹2L for seriously injured
content: Chief Minister also announced ₹2 lakh for those seriously injured, and ₹1 lakh for those with minor injuries

title: SSC results: Andhra Pradesh records 81.14% pass percentage
content: Girls outperform boys by securing 5.78% higher pass percentage; 1,680 schools achieve 100% pass rate, 19 schools report 0% pass rate

title: 4 militants, 2 Arambai Tenggol members arrested in Manipur
content: Multiple arrests of militants in Manipur, including KCP, PREPAK, and KYKL members, with weapons seized by security forces

title: Maharashtra govt. faces legal notice over decision to move Dharavi residents to Deonar dump yard
content: The activist mentioned that Deonar is not even a closed landfill and is one of the top 22 methane spots in the country, releasing an average of 6,202 kg of methane every hour.

title: Odisha man’s miserly life stuns all after death
content: Cash stashed in the most unexpected corners of dilapidated home of hospital sweeper, Dambaru Gorada, surprises many

title: Excise issues summons to Shine Tom Chacko, Sreenath Bhasi in hybrid ganja case
content: On April 1, excise sleuths seized three kilograms of hybrid ganja from a resort at Omanapuzha in Alappuzha.

title: Three from West Bengal killed in Pahalgam terror attack, W.B. government reaches to bereaved families
content: Bitan Adhikari, a resident of Baishnabghata in Kolkata and Sameer Guha, who resided in Behala in the city and Manish Ranjan from Jhalda in Purulia were killed by terrorist.  All the three of them were visiting Jammu and Kashmir with their families

title: Major terror attacks on civilians in Kashmir since 2000: Timeline
content: The deadliest attack on civilians before this incident was 25 years ago in March 2000, when 36 Indians were killed.

title: Karnataka sets up helpline for tourists stranded in Kashmir after terror attack
content: Relatives and friends can contact the Tourism Department through the following helpline numbers: 080-43344334, 080-43344335, 080-43344336, and 080-43344342

title: Five from Bengal govt run study centre make it to Civil Services merit list
content: Officials of SNTCSSC said that over the past few years, about 15 to 20 candidates have made it to the interviews of the Civil Services Examination and five to six candidates make it to the merit list.

title: TASMAC versus ED case: Madras High Court dismisses pleas against search and seizure operation
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar say that people are the best judges of whether there is any political motive behind the search operation

title: Telangana ramps up security at key locations post Pahalgam terror strike
content: According to DGP Jitender, following the terrorist attacks in Pahalgam on innocent tourists, police presence has been increased across public places, prominent landmarks, and transportation centres such as railway stations and bus terminals in Telangana

title: Senior citizens in India grapple with long distances to health facilities, study finds
content: The study notes that older adults, on an average, travelled a distance of  14.54 km to seek outpatient services and 43.62 km for inpatient care respectively; those living rurally have to travel far greater distances than their urban counterparts

title: Wolverhampton-Bangalore Research and Innovation Centre inaugurated in Bengaluru
content: Prof. Suresh Renukappa, Director of the Centre, stated that the centre would focus on climate resilience, healthcare, smart cities and villages, energy security, waste-to-wealth initiatives, pollution control, and the Brand Bengaluru initiative

title: Security beefed up in Delhi following terror attack in Pahalgam
content: Delhi Police has ramped up security across the city, focusing particularly on the tourist hotspots and border checkpoints, officials said

title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman cuts short U.S. visit in view of Pahalgam terror attack
content: Condemning the attack, Ms. Sitharaman said “there are no words to express grief” as she paid condolences to the deceased.

title: Five years after 2020 Delhi riots, court frames charges of vandalism and arson against 57 persons
content: Additional sessions judge (ASJ) Pulastya Pramachala on March 15, had said that the evidence on the record prima facie shows that the accused persons were part of an unlawful assembly, which came into action with the common objective of going on rampage and damage properties.

title: Day after terror attack in Pahalgam, infiltration bid foiled in Kashmir’s Uri
content: Army foils infiltration bid in North Kashmir’s Baramulla district, engaging in firefight with 2-3 terrorists on April 23

title: Arrest of Anjaneyulu is ‘shameful distraction politics’, says Roja
content: Naidu’s policies have harmed farmers, fuelled land, liquor, and mining scams, alleges the YSRCP leader

title: Schrager's NFL mock draft: 32 predictions based on sources in the league
content: Peter Schrager's debut piece for ESPN is a Round 1 mock draft based on what he's hearing from his sources around the NFL.

title: Bailey entering NBA draft, shares Rutgers 'love'
content: Rutgers freshman Ace Bailey, the projected No. 3 pick in this year's NBA draft, is going pro, saying he is "nowhere close to reaching my potential" and "can take a good team to a better level."

title: Lakers, sparked by Redick ripping, tie up series
content: The Lakers were motivated by a JJ Redick tirade after their lead slipped in the third quarter, closing out a 94-85 win over the Timberwolves to even their first-round series.

title: Haliburton blunt about bad blood in Bucks-Pacers
content: "We don't like them, they don't like us and that's just what it is," Pacers guard Tyrese Haliburton said after Indiana took a 2-0 lead in the series with Milwaukee.

title: Thunder pour it on again, laud balanced attack
content: The Thunder have outscored the Grizzlies by a combined 70 points, the second-highest point differential through two games of a series in playoff history.

title: 'Incredible' Tkachuk returns, nets 2 for Panthers
content: Florida forward Matthew Tkachuk made his long-awaited return to the lineup, scoring twice in the second period, as the Panthers handled the rival Tampa Bay Lightning, 6-2, in their Eastern Conference first-round series opener at Amalie Arena on Tuesday.

title: Mike Patrick, longtime ESPN broadcaster, dies
content: Mike Patrick, who spent 36 years as a play-by-play commentator for ESPN and was the network's first NFL voice for "Sunday Night Football," has died at age 80.

title: Jones: Cowboys working on 'substantive trades'
content: Owner and general manager Jerry Jones said Tuesday the Cowboys are working on "pretty substantive trades" ahead of the NFL draft.

title: Ex-NFL kicker Feely to run for Congress in Ariz.
content: Former NFL kicker Jay Feely is leaving the broadcast booth after a decade and entering the political arena, telling ESPN's Josh Weinfuss on Tuesday that he will run for the U.S. House of Representatives in Arizona's 5th Congressional District.

title: Inside the monthslong saga that led to Nico Iamaleava's shocking Tennessee transfer

title: Source: Rashford eyes Champions League club next
content: Marcus Rashford is open to returning to Manchester United he does not believe he has the chance of first-team football while Ruben Amorim remains, a source told ESPN.

title: Pep: City's season 'bad' even if we qualify for UCL
content: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola scoffed at suggestions that his team could look back on this season as a special one if they clinch a Champions League berth.

title: Abramovich to break silence on Chelsea sale
content: Former Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich has spoken for the first time about his sale of the club in a book that will be released this summer.

title: Poch will only select 'right characters' for USMNT
content: USMNT head coach Mauricio Pochettino emphasized the importance of selecting players with a strong mentality heading into the Gold Cup this summer.

title: Player dies after collapsing ahead of SA match
content: South African footballer Sinamandla Zondi died on Tuesday after collapsing in the warm-up before a second-tier match, his club Durban City said.

title: Bay FC eyes record NWSL crowd at Giants ballpark
content: Bay FC will play the Washington Spirit in a National Women's Soccer League match at Oracle Park, home of baseball's San Francisco Giants.

title: Ex-KC GK Schult: Euro teams don't want moms
content: As an Olympic gold medalist and Champions League winner, Almuth Schult was one of the top goalkeepers in women's soccer. She believes her career ended early because European clubs were reluctant to sign a player with children.

title: TST: Solo, Agüero learn matchups for $1M tourney

title: Airlines Issue Travel Advisory For Passengers Stranded In Srinagar Amid Terror Attack
content: SpiceJet have extended waivers on rescheduling and cancellations for travel to and from Srinagar until April 30. The condition is applied to the tickets which have been booked before or on April 22.

title: Delhi Court Issues Non-Bailable Warrant Against Medha Patkar In Defamation Case
content: A Delhi court on Wednesday issued a non-bailable warrant against Narmada Bachao Andolan leader Medha Patkar for flouting its order asking her to submit probation bonds and deposit Rs 1 lakh fine in a defamation case filed by Delhi LG V K Saxena.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Updates: Cabinet Committee On Security To Meet Shortly, Rajnath Vows 'Strong Response'
content: Kashmir terror attack updates: At least 26 civilians, mostly tourists, were shot dead by terrorists in Pahalgam in Jammu & Kashmir's Anantnag district on Tuesday, marking one of the deadliest attacks in the Valley since the Pulwama strike in 2019.

title: "In Complete Shock": Grandparents Of Nepali National Killed In Pahalgam Attack
content: Grandparents of the 27-year-old Sudip Neupane are in sorrow and pain. The octogenarians are in a state of shock and dismay as they lost their grandchild in a terror attack in Pahalgam of Jammu-Kashmir on Tuesday.

title: After Pahalgam Terror Attack, RSS Calls For "Appropriate Action"
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, the ideological mentor of the BJP, today urged the government to take "appropriate action" against those responsible for the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Wedding Anniversary Turns Tragic As Raipur Businessman Killed In Pahalgam Attack
content: Raipur-based businessman Dinesh Mirania was celebrating his wedding anniversary with his family members during their vacation in Kashmir's Pahalgam, when the happy occasion turned into a tragedy as he was killed by terrorists in front of his family.

title: Married On 16th, Tragedy On 22nd: Navy Officer's Wife Salutes Coffin
content: She got married to a Lieutenant in the Indian Navy and then left for Jammu and Kashmir for her honeymoon. Less than a week later, she found herself hugging her husband's coffin.

title: Full Refund From Hotels, Airlines:  Union Minister Assures J&K Tourists
content: The Centre is fully backing tourists in Jammu and Kashmir, who are keen on returning home after the shocking attack on tourist in Pahalgam, Union minister for tourism Gajendra Shekhawat said today.

title: Father-Son Duo Among 26 Killed In Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Three people, including a father-son duo, from Gujarat have been killed in a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: As Pahalgam Victims' Coffins Brought Home, Calls For Decisive Action Grow: 10 Points
content: The coffins carrying the bodies of tourists who were killed by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam reached Srinagar airport today. While the nation mourns the huge loss, citizens have joined hands to demand decisive action against terrorists.

title: Air Force Staff Was On Kashmir Trip With Wife, Terrorists Shot Him Dead
content: Corporal Tage Hailyang (30), an Indian Air Force staff from Arunachal Pradesh, was on a holiday to Kashmir with his wife. The couple were in Pahalgam yesterday when a group of terrorists opened fire, killing at least 26 people

title: 32-Year-Old Jaipur Resident Among 26 Killed In Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Neeraj Udhwani, a 33-year-old resident of Jaipur, was among the victims of the deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, on April 22. His body is expected to arrive in Jaipur later tonight.

title: Indore Resident Killed, Daughter Injured In Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: On Tuesday evening, a terrorist opened fire on the family, fatally wounding Sushil Nathaniel. His body will reach Indore at 8.15 pm on Wednesday by Air India flight.

title: "He Tried To Stop Attack": Omar Abdullah At Pony Ride Operator's Funeral
content: Syed Adil Hussain Shah worked as a pony ride operator at Pahalgam's Baisaran meadow, a tourist hotspot popularly known as 'Mini Switzerland' for its scenic beauty. The young man would ferry tourists on a pony from the car park to the meadow.

title: 'Reiterate Commitment To Fight Against Terrorism': Bangladesh On J&K Attack
content: Bangladesh has "strongly condemned" the terror attack in Pahalgam, a statement issued nearly 24 hours after the attack.

title: Strong Earthquake Of 6.2 Magnitude Strikes Istanbul
content: A strong earthquake with a magnitude of 6.2 shook Istanbul on Wednesday, Turkey's AFAD disaster agency said, one of the strongest quakes to strike the city of 16 million in recent years.

title: Dharavi Redevelopment To Ensure Housing For All: Devendra Fadnavis To NDTV
content: The Dharavi redevelopment will not only serve as a "cornerstone" project for Mumbai but for all the cities across the state, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said on Wednesday.

title: 31-Year-Old Shot In Head By Terrorists, UP Village Goes Into Mourning
content: A village in Kanpur district has gone into mourning after one of its residents, a businessman who got married in February, was killed in Tuesday's terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: China Condemns Pahalgam Attack That Killed 26, Offers "Sincere Sympathies"
content: Twenty-six people were killed in one of the worst terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam on Tuesday.

title: Pahalgam Ponywallah Bravely Tried To Snatch Terrorist's Rifle, Was Shot Dead
content: Syed Adil Hussain Shah, who ferried tourists on his horse in Pahalgam, was shot dead during his attempt to fight one of the terrorists.
